p: IFN-I are produced by most cell types, the best known members of this group are IFN- α and IFN- β, and it also includes IFN- ο, IFN- δ, IFN- κ, IFN- ε, IFN- τ, and IFN- ω [ 4, 5], which directly mediate a potent antiviral response. IFN- α includes 13 partially homologous members, encoded by chromosome 9, while IFN- β is composed by a single member and the gene is located on chromosome 12 [ 4].
